header: 1 CNR No.MHPU01­000195­19 Mayur Motiram Rathod Vs. State of Maharashtra (Khadak Police Station ) Order below exh. 1 in Cri. Bail application No.44/2019

background.text: 1. This is an application U/s.439 of Cr.P.C. filed by the applicant­accused for grant of bail in connection with Crime No.370/2018, registered with Khadak Police Station for the offence punishable u/s.307 r/w.s 34 of the Indian Penal Code and u/s. 37(1)/135 of the Mumbai Police Act.

legalActFound.stringMatched: u/s.307 r/w.s 34 of the indian penal code
u/s. 37(1)/135 of the mumbai police act

legalAct.actShortNameList: Bombay Police Act,Mumbai Police Act,Maharashtra Police Act

legalActFound.stringMatched: u/s. 37(1)/135 of the Mumbai Police Act

legalAct.actShortNameList: Bombay Police Act,Mumbai Police Act,Maharashtra Police Act

arguments.text: 2. Prosecution case is that on 21/10/2018 at about 02­35 p.m. at S. No.2004, Sadashiv Peth, Tilak road, Pune, present applicant/accused along with other co­accused, in furtherance of their common intention assaulted on victim­Dinesh Kamble and with intent to kill him, caused grievous injuries with knife on vital part of injured.

argumentSentences.text: Prosecution case is that on 21/10/2018 at about 02­35 p.m. at S. No.2004, Sadashiv Peth, Tilak road, Pune, present applicant/accused along with other co­accused, in furtherance of their common intention assaulted on victim­Dinesh Kamble and with intent to kill him, caused grievous injuries with knife on vital part of injured.

arguments.text: 3. Learned counsel for the applicant/accused submitted that applicant/accused has not committed any offence, he has been falsely implicated in this offence. She further submitted that juvenile in conflict has caused injuries to injured. She further submitted that name of applicant/accused intentionally implicated in this crime. She further submitted that applicant/accused has not caused any injury to the victim. She further submitted that victim is now discharged from hospital. Custodial interrogation of the applicant­accused is now not necessary, therefore, applicant/accused be released on bail.

argumentSentences.text: Learned counsel for the applicant/accused submitted that applicant/accused has not committed any offence, he has been falsely implicated in this offence.
She further submitted that juvenile in conflict has caused injuries to injured.
She further submitted that name of applicant/accused intentionally implicated in this crime.
She further submitted that applicant/accused has not caused any injury to the victim.
She further submitted that victim is now discharged from hospital.
Custodial interrogation of the applicant­accused is now not necessary, therefore, applicant/accused be released on bail.

arguments.text: 4. Per contra, learned APP submitted that name of applicant/accused is mentioned in the FIR and he was taken in cusotdy from the spot of incident. He further submitted that there are eye witnesses to show that the applicant/accused has assaulted 2 victim. He further submitted that applicant/accused is habitual offender and some serious offences are pending against him, therefore, his application be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: Per contra, learned APP submitted that name of applicant/accused is mentioned in the FIR and he was taken in cusotdy from the spot of incident.
He further submitted that there are eye witnesses to show that the applicant/accused has assaulted 2 victim.
He further submitted that applicant/accused is habitual offender and some serious offences are pending against him, therefore, his application be rejected.

arguments.text: 5. On perusing case diary, prima facie it reveals that on the basis of statement of Sachin Mali, a crime No.370/2018 came to be registered at Khadak Police Station, for the offence punishable u/s.307 r/w.s 34 of the Indian Penal Code and u/s. 37(1)/135 of the Mumbai Police Act. Moreover from FIR, it reveals that on 21/10/2018, Sachin Mali received information about incident, therefore, he rushed to the spot of incident,and shifted injured to the hospital. Moreover, from the statement of witness­Amit Pawar, it reveals that on 21/10/2018 at about 01­30 p.m., when he was proceeding by Tilak road, Pune, he heard shouts from dilapidated building, therefore, he gave call to Police Control Room, and thereafter, he along with his brother entered in the said building, where he found victim in injured condition. He caught other three boys including present applicant/accused. Moreover, Dinesh Kamble­ injured in his statement stated that on instigation of present applicant/accused, Mahesh Tiwari­ juvenile in conflict inflicted blow of knife on his forehead, abdomen etc., and caused injuries. Thus, as per statement of injured­Dinesh Kamble, accused­Mahesh Tiwar­ juvenile in conflict inflicted blow of knife on him and caused grievous injuries. So far as allegations against present applicant/ accused is concerned, at the time of incident, he suggested to Mahesh Tiwari – juvenile in conflict for making assault. Moreover, it appears that present applicant/accused is in custody from 21/10/2018. Investigating officer has already seized knife used for the alleged commission of offence. Thus,custodial interrogation of present applicant/accused is now not necessary. Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­accused is released 3 on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution. Hence, I pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: On perusing case diary, prima facie it reveals that on the basis of statement of Sachin Mali, a crime No.370/2018 came to be registered at Khadak Police Station, for the offence punishable u/s.307 r/w.s 34 of the Indian Penal Code and u/s. 37(1)/135 of the Mumbai Police Act.
Moreover from FIR, it reveals that on 21/10/2018, Sachin Mali received information about incident, therefore, he rushed to the spot of incident,and shifted injured to the hospital.

Moreover, from the statement of witness­Amit Pawar, it reveals that on 21/10/2018 at about 01­30 p.m., when he was proceeding by Tilak road, Pune, he heard shouts from dilapidated building, therefore, he gave call to Police Control Room, and thereafter, he along with his brother entered in the said building, where he found victim in injured condition.
He caught other three boys including present applicant/accused.

Moreover, Dinesh Kamble­ injured in his statement stated that on instigation of present applicant/accused, Mahesh Tiwari­ juvenile in conflict inflicted blow of knife on his forehead, abdomen etc., and caused injuries.
Thus, as per statement of injured­Dinesh Kamble, accused­Mahesh Tiwar­ juvenile in conflict inflicted blow of knife on him and caused grievous injuries.
So far as allegations against present applicant/ accused is concerned, at the time of incident, he suggested to Mahesh Tiwari – juvenile in conflict for making assault.
Moreover, it appears that present applicant/accused is in custody from 21/10/2018.
Investigating officer has already seized knife used for the alleged commission of offence.
Thus,custodial interrogation of present applicant/accused is now not necessary.
Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­accused is released 3 on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution.
Hence, I pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER i. Application is allowed. ii. The applicant­accused ­Mayur Motiram Rathod be released on bail on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty five Thousand Only) with one or two solvent sureties in like amount. iii. The applicant­accused shall not tamper with prosecution evidence. iv. The applicant­accused shall attend concerned Police Station on every Monday and Thursday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­sheet. v. The applicant­accused shall not leave Pune District without prior permission of this Court, till final disposal of the case. vi. The applicant­accused shall furnish fresh residential address to concerned Police Station and to this Court in case he changed present address. vii. The applicant­accused shall attend the court regularly till final disposal of the case.

footer: Date : 10/01/2019 (K.D.Vadane) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. 4 “I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Order are same word to word as per original judgment.” Name of Steno : Shri S. B. Gore, Stenographer Grade­I Court Name : K.D. Vadane , Addl. Sessions Judge, Pune Date : 10/01/2019 Order signed by presiding officer on : 10/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 11/01/2019
processedText:
1 CNR No.MHPU01­000195­19 Mayur Motiram Rathod Vs. State of Maharashtra (Khadak Police Station ) Order below exh. 1 in Cri. Bail application No.44/2019 
---header-ends---
1. This is an application U/s.439 of Cr.P.C. filed by the applicant­accused for grant of bail in connection with Crime No.370/2018, registered with Khadak Police Station for the offence punishable u/s.307 r/w.s 34 of the Indian Penal Code and u/s. 37(1)/135 of the Mumbai Police Act. 
---background-ends---
2. Prosecution case is that on 21/10/2018 at about 02­35 p.m. at S. No.2004, Sadashiv Peth, Tilak road, Pune, present applicant/accused along with other co­accused, in furtherance of their common intention assaulted on victim­Dinesh Kamble and with intent to kill him, caused grievous injuries with knife on vital part of injured. 
---argument-ends---
3. Learned counsel for the applicant/accused submitted that applicant/accused has not committed any offence, he has been falsely implicated in this offence. She further submitted that juvenile in conflict has caused injuries to injured. She further submitted that name of applicant/accused intentionally implicated in this crime. She further submitted that applicant/accused has not caused any injury to the victim. She further submitted that victim is now discharged from hospital. Custodial interrogation of the applicant­accused is now not necessary, therefore, applicant/accused be released on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4. Per contra, learned APP submitted that name of applicant/accused is mentioned in the FIR and he was taken in cusotdy from the spot of incident. He further submitted that there are eye witnesses to show that the applicant/accused has assaulted 2 victim. He further submitted that applicant/accused is habitual offender and some serious offences are pending against him, therefore, his application be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
5. On perusing case diary, prima facie it reveals that on the basis of statement of Sachin Mali, a crime No.370/2018 came to be registered at Khadak Police Station, for the offence punishable u/s.307 r/w.s 34 of the Indian Penal Code and u/s. 37(1)/135 of the Mumbai Police Act. Moreover from FIR, it reveals that on 21/10/2018, Sachin Mali received information about incident, therefore, he rushed to the spot of incident,and shifted injured to the hospital. Moreover, from the statement of witness­Amit Pawar, it reveals that on 21/10/2018 at about 01­30 p.m., when he was proceeding by Tilak road, Pune, he heard shouts from dilapidated building, therefore, he gave call to Police Control Room, and thereafter, he along with his brother entered in the said building, where he found victim in injured condition. He caught other three boys including present applicant/accused. Moreover, Dinesh Kamble­ injured in his statement stated that on instigation of present applicant/accused, Mahesh Tiwari­ juvenile in conflict inflicted blow of knife on his forehead, abdomen etc., and caused injuries. Thus, as per statement of injured­Dinesh Kamble, accused­Mahesh Tiwar­ juvenile in conflict inflicted blow of knife on him and caused grievous injuries. So far as allegations against present applicant/ accused is concerned, at the time of incident, he suggested to Mahesh Tiwari – juvenile in conflict for making assault. Moreover, it appears that present applicant/accused is in custody from 21/10/2018. Investigating officer has already seized knife used for the alleged commission of offence. Thus,custodial interrogation of present applicant/accused is now not necessary. Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­accused is released 3 on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution. Hence, I pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER i. Application is allowed. ii. The applicant­accused ­Mayur Motiram Rathod be released on bail on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty five Thousand Only) with one or two solvent sureties in like amount. iii. The applicant­accused shall not tamper with prosecution evidence. iv. The applicant­accused shall attend concerned Police Station on every Monday and Thursday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­sheet. v. The applicant­accused shall not leave Pune District without prior permission of this Court, till final disposal of the case. vi. The applicant­accused shall furnish fresh residential address to concerned Police Station and to this Court in case he changed present address. vii. The applicant­accused shall attend the court regularly till final disposal of the case. 
---order-ends---
Date : 10/01/2019 (K.D.Vadane) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. 4 “I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Order are same word to word as per original judgment.” Name of Steno : Shri S. B.
